greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference between the smallest number S(n) with S(n)! a multiple of n and the largest prime factor of n [taking a(1)=0].
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge, 2003, pp. 284-292.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Steven R. Finch, The Average Value of the Smarandache Function [Broken link]
Steven R. Finch, The Average Value of the Smarandache Function
example: a(12)=1 since 12 is a factor of 4!, 3 is the largest prime factor of 12 and 4-3=1
program: A002034(n) = if(1==n,n, my(s=factor(n)[, 1], k=s[#s], f=Mod(k!, n)); while(f, f*=k++); (k)); \\ After code in A002034.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Aug 08 2000
ext: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Aug 22 2000
